newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft not planning to buy CBS- execs.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft not planning to buy CBS- execs.

text.p: Microsoft Corp has no plans to buy CBS, and officials of the software giant are at a loss to explain how a rumor to the contrary got started, company executives said Tuesday.
"We are not looking to buy CBS," said one executive, who requested anonymity.

The executive noted that Microsoft has close ties with General Electric Co's NBC network, including the MSNBC joint venture, which employs scores of people at Microsoft's Redmond, Washington, headquarters.
Microsoft has a 50-percent stake in the MSNBC joint venture.

Officials of CBS, a unit of Westinghouse Electric Corp, also have denied a report in Tuesday's New York Post that said both Microsoft and Seagram Co Ltd were considering a bid for the broadcast network.
Westinghouse officials further stated there was no truth to the rumor they were selling CBS, adding that there is no outside party examining CBS's books.
A spokesman for Seagrams said the Canadian company has no comment on the Post report.
